title: A Unified Framework for U-Net Design and Analysis. (arXiv:2305.19638v1 [stat.ML])
abstract: U-Nets are a go-to, state-of-the-art neural architecture across numerous tasks for continuous signals on a square such as images and Partial Differential Equations (PDE), however their design and architecture is understudied. In this paper, we provide a framework for designing and analysing general U-Net architectures. We present theoretical results which characterise the role of the encoder and decoder in a U-Net, their high-resolution scaling limits and their conjugacy to ResNets via preconditioning. We propose Multi-ResNets, U-Nets with a simplified, wavelet-based encoder without learnable parameters. Further, we show how to design novel U-Net architectures which encode function constraints, natural bases, or the geometry of the data. tldr: 本研究提供了一个统一框架，用于设计和分析通用的U-Net架构，包括Multi-ResNets以及如何编码函数约束、自然基或数据的几何形状。我们展示了如何确定高频信息被噪声支配的速度，以及平均池化的U-Net如何利用这一点。同时我们在实验中展示了Multi-ResNets的协同学习以及在各种任务上的最佳性能。
en_tdlr: This paper proposes a unified framework for designing and analyzing U-Net architectures, including Multi-ResNets and how to encode function constraints, natural bases, or the geometry of the data. The study shows how to determine the speed at which high-frequency information is dominated by noise and how average-pooling U-Nets exploit this. Finally, the experiments demonstrate the synergy learning of Multi-ResNets and their best performance in various tasks.
